thread.title: Arkansas State Fair to begin 10-day run in Little Rock

title: Arkansas State Fair to begin 10-day run in Little Rock
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Arkansas State Fair to begin 10-day run in Little Rock The Arkansas State Fair opens its gates Friday for a 10-day run featuring concerts, rides and new types of fair food. Post to Facebook Arkansas State Fair to begin 10-day run in Little Rock The Arkansas State Fair opens its gates Friday for a 10-day run featuring concerts, rides and new types of fair food.  //on.kthv.com/1LlC6rj   Arkansas State Fair to begin 10-day run in Little Rock Associated Press, news source 8:27 a.m. CDT October 9, 2015 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE The Arkansas State Fair opens its gates Friday for a 10-day run featuring concerts, rides and new types of fair food. -- THV11.com 10/09/15 KTHV 
LITTLE ROCK, Ark. (AP) - The Arkansas State Fair opens its gates Friday for a 10-day run featuring concerts, rides and new types of fair food. General Manager Ralph Shoptaw says the fair will offer special promotions and discounts daily, including free admission and parking on weekdays from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. so visitors can eat lunch at the fair. Those lunch options will include new foods like the bacon bomber, apple pie fries and ice cream and Arkansas' biggest fried pickle on a stick. Shoptaw says a free shuttle will be available on weekends to alleviate parking woes caused by construction on Roosevelt Road. Visitors can park in designated state government parking lots west of the state Capitol and a shuttle will take them to the fair.
